title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point the response must reference gallons of gasoline added/pumped and the time interval t=60 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGOnaiaaicdaaaa@3C75@ to t=135 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaiodacaaI1aaaaa@3D32@ .

To earn the second point at least five of the six factors in the Riemann sum must be correct.

If there is any error in the Riemann sum, the response does not earn the third point.

A response of (0.15)(30)+(0.1)(30)+(0.05)(15) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4F2F@ earns both the second and third points, unless there is a subsequent error in simplification, in which case the response would earn only the second point.

A response that presents a correct value with accompanying work that shows the three products in the Riemann sum but does not show all six of the factors and/or the sum process, does not earn the second point but does earn the third point. For example, responses of either 4.5+3.0+0.75 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4223@ or (0.15)(30),0.1(30),0.05(15)→8.25 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@50F5@ earn the third point but not the second.

A response of f(90)(90−60)+f(120)(120−90)+f(135)(135−120)=8.25 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5D44@ earns both the second and the third points.

A response that presents an answer of only 8.25 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C0A@ does not earn either the second or third point.

A response that provides a completely correct left Riemann sum with accompanying work, f(60)(30)+f(90)(30)+f(120)(15)=9, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@519F@ or (0.1)(30)+(0.15)(30)+(0.1)(15) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4E71@ earns 1 of the last 2 points. A response with any errors or missing factors in a left Riemann sum earns neither of the last 2 points.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes two of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes all three of the criteria below.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

To earn the first point a response must present either f(120)−f(60)=0, MathType@MTEF@5@5@@448C@ 0.1−0.1=0 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3FF7@ (perhaps as the numerator of a quotient), or f(60)=f(120). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@42E7@

To earn the second point a response must:

  • have earned the first point,

  • state that f MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E7@ is continuous because f MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWGMbaaaa@39E7@ is differentiable (or equivalent), and

  • answer “yes” in some way.

A response may reference either the Mean Value Theorem or Rolle’s Theorem.

A response that references the Intermediate Value Theorem cannot earn the second point.
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The exact value of 1 150 ∫ 0 150 g(t)dt MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4632@ is 12 125 sin( 25 16 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@44A2@

A response may present the average value formula in single or multiple steps. For example, the following response earns both points: ∫ 0 150 g(t)dt =14.399504 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4AAF@ so the average rate is 0.0959967. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@405D@

A response that presents the average value formula in multiple steps but provides incorrect or incomplete communication (e.g., ∫ 0 150 g(t)dt = 14.399504 150 =0.0959967 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@54A8@ ) earns 1 out of 2 points.

A response of ∫ 0 150 g(t)dt=0.0959967 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4B76@ does not earn either point.

Degree mode: A response that presents answers obtained by using a calculator in degree mode does not earn the first point it would have otherwise earned. The response is generally eligible for all subsequent points (unless no answer is possible in degree mode or the question is made simpler by using degree mode). In degree mode, 1 150 ∫ 0 150 g(t)dt =0.149981 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4CF8@ or 0.002618. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F87@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples to score the response.

The exact value of g ′ (140) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7F@ is 1 500 cos( 49 36 )− 49 9000 sin( 49 36 ). MathType@MTEF@5@5@@5094@

The value of g ′ (140) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7F@ may appear only in the interpretation.

To be eligible for the second point a response must present some numerical value for g ′ (140) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7F@ .

To earn the second point the interpretation must include “the rate of flow of gasoline is changing at a rate of [the declared value of g ′ (140) MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D7F@ ]” and “at t=140 MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeaaeaaakeaacaWG0bGaeyypa0JaaGymaiaaisdacaaIWaaaaa@3D2E@ ” (or equivalent).

An interpretation of “decreasing at a rate of – 0.005 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3F02@ ” or “increasing at a rate of ” does not earn the second point.

Degree mode: In degree mode, g ′ (140)=0.001997 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4435@ or 0.00187. MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3ECC@
descriptions: The student response does not accurately include any of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes one of the criteria below.
The student response accurately includes both of the criteria below.
